Class BotPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • HumanPlayer
      • BotPlayer
  • public class BotPlayer
extends HumanPlayer
    Represents an AI controlled player. Its purpose is to find and chase the HumanPlayer. Only 1 instance of BotPlayer will exist

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      BotPlayer()
      Create an instance of BotPlayer

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void botMoveRandom​(Map map)
      Move the bot in a random direction
      void changeCanSeePlayer()  
      boolean doBlindSwitch()
      Causes the value of blindSwitch to allow the bot to alternate its action each turn.
      boolean getCanSeePlayer()
      Returns boolean value of canSeePlayer.
      boolean getSearching()
      Returns boolean value of searching.
      void setTargetPos​(int playerX, int playerY)
      Once the bot can see the player, it sets the player's location as its target
      void switchSearching()
      Flips the boolean value of searching, to determine if the bot is currently tracking the human.

      • doBlindSwitch

        public boolean doBlindSwitch()
        Causes the value of blindSwitch to allow the bot to alternate its action each turn.
        Returns:
        blindSwitch : current boolean value of blindSwitch

      • getCanSeePlayer

        public boolean getCanSeePlayer()
        Returns boolean value of canSeePlayer.
        Returns:
        canSeePlayer : boolean value of whether the bot can see the human

      • getSearching

        public boolean getSearching()
        Returns boolean value of searching.
        Returns:
        searching : boolean value of whether the bot is chasing the human

      • setTargetPos

        public void setTargetPos​(int playerX,
                         int playerY)
        Once the bot can see the player, it sets the player's location as its target
        Parameters:
        playerX - : current x co-ordinate of player
        playerY - : current y co-ordinate of player

      • switchSearching

        public void switchSearching()
        Flips the boolean value of searching, to determine if the bot is currently tracking the human.
